GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Catecholamine blood tests measure the amount of catecholamines in your body. “Catecholamines” is an umbrella term for the hormones dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine.
Catecholamine blood tests measure the amount of catecholamines in your body. “Catecholamines” is an umbrella term for the hormones dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine.

A carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) test is a blood test used to help diagnose and manage certain types of cancers. The CEA test is used especially for cancers of the large intestine and rectum. The CEA test measures the amount of CEA in the blood. A high amount of CEA in your body after a cancer treatment or surgery suggests the cancer is not gone. It may also mean that the cancer has spread to other parts of your body.

A carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) test is a blood test used to help diagnose and manage certain types of cancers. The CEA test is used especially for cancers of the large intestine and rectum. The CEA test measures the amount of CEA in the blood. A high amount of CEA in your body after a cancer treatment or surgery suggests the cancer is not gone. It may also mean that the cancer has spread to other parts of your body.

A colonoscopy is a medical procedure that is done to look for cancer, colon polyps or other abnormalities inside your bowel. Colonoscopy is done using an instrument called a colonoscope (a type of endoscope) — a long, thin, flexible tube containing a camera and a light.
